METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Jugoslovansko vprašanje v Zwittrovem delu
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Fran Zwitter and the Yugoslav Question
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Stergar, Rok
METS:xmlData.dcterms:description: Jugoslovanskega vprašanja se je Fran Zwitter lotil večkrat, in sicer tako v sintetičnih študijah kot tudi v monografskih raziskavah. Razpravljal je o širokem časovnem loku, saj je posegel tako v predzgodovino jugoslovanstva, v intelektualne tokove renesanse, kot tudi v čas prve svetovne vojne. Tri teme, ki jih je raziskoval najbolj podrobno, so bile: čas Ilirskih provinc, ljubljanski jugoslovanski kongres leta 1870 in njegova predzgodovina ter obdobje 1. svetovne vojne. Pri tem ni ostajal na nivoju vsakodnevne politike, ampak so ga bolj zanimali trendi, ki so postali prepoznavni šele v daljših obdobjih.

Fran Zwitter wrote about the Yugoslav question several times, both in synthetic studies and in several monographs. Covering an extensive time period, he discussed the prehistory of the Yugoslav question, enlightened ideas of the Renaissance, and World War One. The three themes that Zwitter had researched at greatest length were the period of the Illyrian Provinces, the 1870 Congress in Ljubljana and its prehistory, and the First World War. Far more than in everyday politics and events he was interested in the trends that became more obvious only after longer periods of time.
METS:xmlData.dcterms:subject: Fran Zwitter

Razpravljal je o širokem časovnem loku, saj je posegel tako v predzgodovino jugoslovanstva, v intelektualne tokove renesanse, kot tudi v čas prve svetovne vojne. Tri teme, ki jih je raziskoval najbolj podrobno, so bile: čas Ilirskih provinc, ljubljanski jugoslovanski kongres leta 1870 in njegova predzgodovina ter obdobje 1. svetovne vojne. Pri tem ni ostajal na nivoju vsakodnevne politike, ampak so ga bolj zanimali trendi, ki so postali prepoznavni šele v daljših obdobjih.

Fran Zwitter wrote about the Yugoslav question several times, both in synthetic studies and in several monographs. Covering an extensive time period, he discussed the prehistory of the Yugoslav question, enlightened ideas of the Renaissance, and World War One. The three themes that Zwitter had researched at greatest length were the period of the Illyrian Provinces, the 1870 Congress in Ljubljana and its prehistory, and the First World War.
